member.summary: Creates a scalable spiral displaying a rotation range.
member.param: Host frame. The Z axis is the rotation axis of the spiral, the X axis is the neutral axis of the spiral.
Limited range of the spiral, to avoid display glitches.
Radius of the spiral at 1/1 scale.
Frame at zero, if zero is in the drawn range.
Number of steps to compute per rotation.

members.member: Converts a point from cylindrical coordinates to Cartesian coordinates. //todo: move to core? Reference frame. The polar axis (A) follows X, and the longitudinal axis (L) follows Z.Radial distance () of the point.Angular coordinate () of the point.Height of the point.Cartesian point expressed in the frame coordinates.

member.name: T:HAL.McNeel.RhinoCommon5.Spatial.CurveHelpers
member.summary: Biarc utilities.
Generates a tool path from a curve.
member.param: Curve to generate a path from.
Path resolution, as the maximum allowed deviation in Cartesian space.
If a guide geometry is specified, target axis following the guide geometry.
If a guide geometry is specified, whether the inverse direction of the axis should be used.
Reference system of the resulting path.
Whether the curve is expressed in absolute world location. If false, the curve is considered relative to the reference.

member.summary: Retrieves the plate at a position along a curve, and at the corresponding interpolated rotation.
member.param: Host curve. The domain of the polyCurve must be 0 to 1.
Total rotation angle towards which to interpolate.

member.returns: Rotated plane at the specified position.
